Shia militias in #Iraq are proxies of & controlled by #Iran. They want to use them to kill our troops but have deniability.

Tonight, Rep. Steve King was stripped of all his committee assignments for his embrace of white supremacy.

He will not serve on a single committee for the next 2 years of the 116th Congress.

Committee assignments are powerful. Members spend years working for their desired spot. https://twitter.com/alivelshi/status/1084978928031281153 QT @AliVelshi BREAKING: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy says GOP Steering Committee votes unanimously to remove IA GOP Rep Steve King from all committees.

The difference is that this current GOP admin appeals to the worst within us, stoking an impulse to rationalize erosion. 

I believe we must appeal to the best within us+not settle. We should champion the smartest, prosperous, fair, hardest-working + decent version of ourselves.

Freedom of speech does not mean freedom from consequences.

King’s district should start working to replace him in 2020. Regardless of party, it’s not good for a district if their Rep has such reprehensible views that they aren’t allowed to touch legislation with a 10 ft pole.

Journalism isn’t just about the questions you ask, but the questions you don’t.

If you’re a reporter or pundit who has badgered every Dem about “socialism” yet aren’t asking EVERY Republican about what they plan to do about Rep. King’s white supremacy,you’re telling on yourself.

When I meet everyday people, they are eager to learn more, ask great questions, & embrace nuance.

I inherently reject the paternalistic idea that some subjects are too complex for everyday people to engage. If we present compelling, solid info+common sense arguments, we can win. https://twitter.com/themaxburns/status/1084836382571413504 QT @themaxburns Something @AOC is rarely credited on: she's one of the first members of Congress since Robert F. Kennedy to make issues like tax policy accessible to voters by using humor and clear examples to explain hazy ideas like marginal tax rates. https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1084834446765899776

Mallory, a federal worker at the @Interior, is rationing her remaining two vials of insulin for her type 1 diabetes — she can’t afford the $300 copay since she’s not getting paid. We need to reopen the government today. Put bills up for a vote.
https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/federal-worker-forced-ration-insulin-because-government-shutdown-n958066

It is imperative for the US to review our trade terms with Cambodia. Last week I introduced legislation with @ChrisCoons​ to do exactly this. Teaching is one of the most valuable and indispensable professions. We need to treat educators with respect and dignity.
https://www.jacobinmag.com/2019/01/utla-los-angeles-teachers-strike-privatization

I stand in solidarity with @UTLAnow teachers who began striking today in Los Angeles for the first time in 30 years. Teaching is one of the most valuable and indispensable professions. We need to treat educators with respect and dignity. #UTLAStrong https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/14/us/lausd-teachers-strike.html

As long as desperate people believe that they are going to be able to cross our border many are going to go on the dangerous journey from Central America trafficked by some of the most dangerous people on earth. From that standpoint alone it’s a crisis:  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iCZZgavGjLM&feature=youtu.be

This week I will introduce legislation along with many other members of Congress to raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly benefit over 41 million workers, including over half of African-American workers and nearly 60% of Latino workers.

The cost of prescription drugs is too high in our country and prices just keep rising. That’s why I introduced the Prescription Drug Price Relief Act with my colleagues, which would bring down the costs by ensuring Americans pay close to what people in other countries pay.

If the pharmaceutical industry will not end its greed, which is literally killing Americans, then we will end it for them. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/01/10/bernie-sanders-to-introduce-bills-aimed-at-prescription-drug-costs.html

RT @CR LOL @tedcruz is so right. 

https://www.conservativereview.com/news/watch-ted-cruz-roasts-schumer-and-pelosis-hostage-video-blasts-dems-for-forcing-shutdown/

Giant companies may hate my Affordable Drug Manufacturing bill - but I don’t work for them. The American people deserve competitive markets and fair prices. By fixing the broken generic drug market, we can bring the cost of prescriptions down.https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/elizabeth-warren-its-time-to-let-the-government-manufacture-generic-drugs/2018/12/17/66bc0fb0-023f-11e9-b5df-5d3874f1ac36_story.html?utm_term=.222802097ce2

The federal minimum wage of $7.25 is a starvation wage. That is why I, along with many other members of Congress, will introduce legislation this week to raise that wage to $15 an hour. If you work 40 hours a week, you should not live in poverty.

The time has come to fulfill and expand upon FDR’s vision that he laid out in 1944.

These are not radical ideas. They're supported by the majority of Americans. Working together, we can and we must achieve economic, social, racial, political and environmental justice for all. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dw6LcQPXQAECIGQ.jpg

The reality for American working families is that
-Real wages for average workers are lower than in 1973
-80% of Americans live paycheck to paycheck
-Half of older Americans have no retirement savings
We need to create an economy that works for all of us.

It’s day 24 of the #TrumpShutdown. 800,000 Americans are losing paychecks. The health & safety of countless more are in jeopardy. 

But while @HouseDemocrats have passed @SenateGOP funding bills, @senatemajldr hasn't held a single vote in this Congress to re-open the government. https://twitter.com/senatemajldr/status/1084911859797504000 QT @senatemajldr Enforcing our laws has not become unethical overnight. The physical barriers at the border that Democrats supported yesterday have not somehow become a radical right-wing position today. Border security still matters. American families still deserve safety.

Too many college students are already getting crushed by student loan debt. They shouldn’t have to worry about having enough to eat. I worked with @BHCCBoston to request the first-ever report on food insecurity on campuses from GAO. Our students need help. http://www.golocalworcester.com/news/college-students-across-country-struggling-to-afford-food-says-new-report

The #TrumpShutdown has thrown thousands of federal workers & their families into crisis forcing them to make sacrifices that grow by the day—this must end. A job must lift workers out of poverty, not keep them in it. We must raise the federal minimum wage from a starvation wage of $7.25 an hour to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly increase the wages of more than 25 percent of the U.S. workforce.

RT @RepTimRyan Tonight, I started the 2-day clock on my bipartisan resolution to censure Rep. Steve King for his racist support of white supremacy.

Trump says the economy is "booming." It is—for the top 10 CEOs who saw their combined compensation soar by 60% in 2017. 

For the average worker, however, real wages went up by just 1.2% over the past year. 

The very rich get richer. Working families continue to struggle.

The current Democratic position on shutdown is “no compromise” & @POTUS unconditional surrender on border security.

What happened to all the lectures from commentators about the need to compromise? 

I guess  for them “compromise” means when 3 or 4 Reps vote with the Dems.

America’s seniors have worked hard all their lives and deserve access to affordable prescription drugs. We need to let them purchase cheaper drugs from Canada & give Medicare the ability to negotiate prices. I recently joined colleagues to introduce a bill to allow for this.

Thank you, @RepJayapal! https://twitter.com/repjayapal/status/1084546785773637632 QT @RepJayapal As I said here, my colleague ⁦@AOC⁩ absolutely has the ability to put bold progressive ideas on the map in a whole new way. It's a huge opportunity for us and for all those who have been left out of the conversation for waaay too long.  https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/13/nyregion/ocasio-cortez-democrats-congress.html

Federal lands and waters must not be opened up to fossil fuel extraction. Public lands are national treasures that should be protected for future generations, not auctioned off to the fossil fuel industry’s highest bidders. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2018/12/trumps-war-on-wildlife-should-be-a-scandal.html
I’d say we’d be taxing 70% of Trump’s income, but he probably hasn’t made more than $10 million in years - and that’s the real reason he’s hiding his taxes 😉
